obfuscation: ﻿ Swedish Monarchy, A Nice Tradition, Worth Keeping!?! Inside dictionaries the floor democracy is defined as`` a system, inside government in which everybody in countries can vote to elect its members'' also as`` situation inside which everybody be equality also has entitled to vote, make decisions etc''.
original: ﻿ THE SWEDISH MONARCHY A NICE TRADITION WORTH KEEPING? In dictionaries the word democracy is defined as "a system of government in which everyone in the country can vote to elect its members" and as "a situation in which everyone is equal and has the right to vote, make decisions etc".

obfuscation: Word monarchy is defined as`` system in which a countries is ruled by a king or queen''. Sweden is paradoxical both democracy also a monarchy another way I see it a countries can not or at least will not be both.

obfuscation: The 's a few key arguments I have heard from people which wants to keep the monarchy are that`` Sweden 's still been a monarchy''.`` it 's such nice tradition''.
original: Some of the main arguments I have heard from people who wants to keep the monarchy are that "Sweden has always been a monarchy" and " it's such a nice tradition".

original: Yes, Sweden is one of the oldest monarchies in Europe and we have a history full of fascinating stories about royal war-heroes, conspiracies and mysteriously murdered kings. But those arguments aren't relevant to the issue.

obfuscation: Today 's system and society ca n't be compared with, for sample the with century also our present king Carl XVI rustan ca not be compared, with Carl XII.
original: Today's system and society can't be compared with for example the eighteenth century and our present king Carl XVI Gustav can't be compared with Carl XII.

obfuscation: Word is constantly revolving. Today monarchy be an old-fashioned system which does not fit into democratic society aforesaid as ours. to use history also tradition as arguments inside this serious matter 's just a naive. Ignorant way in trying to avoid discussion. Debate.
original: The word is constantly changing and today monarchy is an old-fashioned system which doesn't fit into a democratic society such as ours. To use history and tradition as arguments in this serious matter is just a naive and ignorant way of trying to avoid discussion and debate.

obfuscation: Our own serves have, to eliminate romantic. Sentimental picture you surrounds royal family also monarchy as a system. We have to look at our society, against logical,. Practical point inside sight. Myself mentioned the floor democracy also it 's concept earlier.
original: We have to eliminate the romantic and sentimental image that surrounds the royal family and the monarchy as a system. We have to look at our society from a logical and practical point of view. I mentioned the word democracy and it's meaning earlier.

obfuscation: People throughout international are fighting, for it. People sacrifice their lives for the voting rights also choose their leaders, right to speak their mind,. The right to be treated, as equals. Democracy 's not, as obvious to everyone as it be for us.
original: People around the world are fighting for it. People sacrifice their lives for the right to vote and choose their leaders, the right to speak their mind and the right to be treated as equals. Democracy is not as obvious to everybody as it is for us.

obfuscation: Inside a monarchy regent be not elected. On the other hand, Swedish monarch is not selected, by the people also he/she does not have the same duties as everyone else.
original: In a monarchy the regent is not elected. The Swedish monarch is not chosen by the people and he/she does not have the same rights as everybody else.

obfuscation: He/she does not have entitled, to voting, he/she 's not free to choose his/her religion. Despite fact this he/she 's the chief in our state he/she has got no policy power.

obfuscation: But still he/she ranks above everybody else; and he/she requires to be addressed, as`` his/her royal highness'' or`` your majesty''. Also all that because he/she was born a crown-prince/princess al. through inheritance became leader in a state. Nor, Sweden 's a democracy.
original: But still he/she ranks above everybody else and he/she requires to be addressed as "his/her royal highness" or "your majesty". And all that because he/she was born a crown-prince/princess and through inheritance became head of a state. Sweden is a democracy.

obfuscation: No, Swedish people want to be treated, as equals also along respect. Meanwhile, Men. Women, homosexual and heterosexuals, natives and immigrant etc.
original: The Swedish people want to be treated as equals and with respect. Men and women, homosexuals and heterosexuals, natives and immigrants etc.

obfuscation: Then why do more than Seventy per cent inside the Swedish population accept that sort inside class-difference also aggregation where a small, limited group, inside individuals are treated as although they were most important.; worth greater respect that the remainder in people just ' cause they were born by royal parents?
original: Then why do more than 70% of the Swedish population accept this kind of class-difference and segregation where a small, limited group of people are treated as if they were more important and worth more respect than the rest of the people just because they were born by royal parents?

History, tradition also popularity are all quite weak arguments pro-monarchy. But they are also very difficult to ignore.

original: These things are deeply rooted in the Swedish people. We have become used to the monarchy and a habit is always difficult to break. But the society of today is in need of a change.

obfuscation: Today 's monarchy be former fashioned. Reactionary system where monarch 's only work seems to be waving at people from balcony, cutting ribbons. Throwing champagne-bottles at vessels. Do our own serves really need this???
original: Today's monarchy is an old fashioned and reactionary system where the monarch's only function seems to be waving at people from a balcony, cutting ribbons and throwing champagne-bottles at boats. Do we really need that?
